intro: Taraxacum steveniiforme, commonly known as the Steven's dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered with fine, white hairs. Taraxacum steveniiforme is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
